intro: Teucrium plectranthoides, commonly known as narrowleaf germander, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, narrow, and slightly hairy leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are usually violet or blue, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the branches. It is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showing adaptability to arid environments.
